alert.note: Alert for Bleckley; Pulaski (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 01 at 3:13AM EDT until April 04 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Ocmulgee River at Abbeville affecting Dodge, Telfair and Wilcox Counties. Ocmulgee River at US 341 at Hawkinsville affecting Bleckley and Pulaski Counties. Oconee River near Mount Vernon affecting Treutlen, Wheeler and Montgomery Counties. Oconee River at Dublin affecting Washington, Wilkinson, Johnson and Laurens Counties. Oconee River near Oconee affecting Washington, Wilkinson and Johnson Counties. For the Ocmulgee River Basin...including Jackson, Griffin, Juliette, Juliette, Dames Ferry, Macon, Macon, Hawkinsville, Byron, Clinchfield, Hawkinsville, Abbeville, McRae, Scotland, Lumber City... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Oconee River Basin...including Penfield, Milledgeville, Oconee, Oconee, McIntyre, Irwinton, Oconee, Dublin, Mount Vernon... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Ocmulgee River at US 341 at Hawkinsville. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 26 feet, Moderate flooding begins...with several homes surrounded by flood waters and at least 3 homes begin flooding near Gooseneck Lane and RiverView Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:45 AM EDT Saturday the stage was 26.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:45 AM EDT Saturday was 27.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Tuesday morning and continue falling to 17.5 feet Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 20 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
